content:
BuildParameters Class

In this Article

This class represents all of the settings which must be specified to start a build.

Syntax

Declaration

public class BuildParameters

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • BuildParameters

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Constructors summary

BuildParameters()

Creates build parameters.
BuildParameters(ProjectCollection)

Creates build parameters and initializes them from a project collection.

Properties summary

BuildProcessEnvironment

Gets the environment variables which were set when this build was created.
BuildThreadPriority

Gets or sets the desired thread priority for building.
Culture

Gets or sets the name of the culture to use during the build.
DefaultToolsVersion

Gets or sets the default tools version for the build.
DetailedSummary

Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether the build should emit a detailed summary at the end of the log.
DisableInProcNode

Gets or sets the flag determining whether to use the in process node.
EnableNodeReuse

Gets or sets a flag determining whether out-of-process nodes should persist after the build and wait for further builds.
EnvironmentProperties

Gets an immutable collection of environment properties.
ForwardingLoggers

Gets or sets the collection of forwarding logger descriptions.
GlobalProperties

Gets or sets an immutable collection of global properties.
HostServices

Gets or sets a service that allows the host to provide additional control over the build process.
LegacyThreadingSemantics

Gets or sets a switch that enables or disables legacy threading semantics.
Loggers

Gets or sets the collection of loggers to use during the build.
LogInitialPropertiesAndItems

Gets or sets the flag determining whether the build logs the input parameters.
LogTaskInputs

Gets or sets the flag determining whether the build logs the task parameters.
MaxNodeCount

Gets or sets the maximum number of nodes this build may use.
MemoryUseLimit

Gets or sets the amount of memory the build should limit itself to using, in megabytes.
NodeExeLocation

Gets or sets the location of the build node executable.
OnlyLogCriticalEvents

Gets or sets a flag that determines if non-critical logging events should be discarded.
ResetCaches

Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether the build should reset the configuration and results caches.
SaveOperatingEnvironment

Gets or sets a switch specifying if the operating environment, such as the current directory and environment, should be saved and restored between project builds and task invocations.
ShutdownInProcNodeOnBuildFinish

Gets or sets the flag determining whether to shut down the in process node when the build finishes. The default is false.
ToolsetDefinitionLocations

Gets or sets locations to search for toolsets.
Toolsets

Gets all of the toolsets.
UICulture

Gets or sets the name of the UI culture to use during the build.
UseSynchronousLogging

Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether synchronous logging is used when there is only a single process.

Methods summary

Clone()

Creates a clone of this build parameters object.
GetToolset(String)

Gets a given toolset.

Constructors

  • BuildParameters()

    Creates build parameters.

    public BuildParameters ();

    Remarks

    Constructor for use in setting all build properties programmatically.

  • BuildParameters(ProjectCollection)

    Creates build parameters and initializes them from a project collection.

    public BuildParameters (Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection projectCollection);

    Parameters

    • projectCollection
      ProjectCollection

      The ProjectCollection from which the BuildParameters should populate itself.

Properties

  • BuildProcessEnvironment

    Gets the environment variables which were set when this build was created.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> BuildProcessEnvironment { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDictionary<String,String>

      Returns environment variables set when build was created.

  • BuildThreadPriority

    Gets or sets the desired thread priority for building.

    public System.Threading.ThreadPriority BuildThreadPriority { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ThreadPriority

      Returns the thread priority for building

  • Culture

    Gets or sets the name of the culture to use during the build.

    public System.Globalization.CultureInfo Culture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • CultureInfo

      Returns the culture.

  • DefaultToolsVersion

    Gets or sets the default tools version for the build.

    public string DefaultToolsVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the tools version.

  • DetailedSummary

    Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether the build should emit a detailed summary at the end of the log.

    public bool DetailedSummary { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the value of a switch that specifies whether the build should emit a detailed summary at the end of the log

  • DisableInProcNode

    Gets or sets the flag determining whether to use the in process node.

    public bool DisableInProcNode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • EnableNodeReuse

    Gets or sets a flag determining whether out-of-process nodes should persist after the build and wait for further builds.

    public bool EnableNodeReuse { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • EnvironmentProperties

    Gets an immutable collection of environment properties.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> EnvironmentProperties { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDictionary<String,String>

      Returns an immutable collection of environment properties.

  • ForwardingLoggers

    Gets or sets the collection of forwarding logger descriptions.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Build.Logging.ForwardingLoggerRecord> ForwardingLoggers { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<ForwardingLoggerRecord>

      Returns the collection of forwarding logger descriptions.

  • GlobalProperties

    Gets or sets an immutable collection of global properties.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> GlobalProperties { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • IDictionary<String,String>

      Returns an immutable collection of global properties.

  • HostServices

    Gets or sets a service that allows the host to provide additional control over the build process.

    public Microsoft.Build.Execution.HostServices HostServices { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • HostServices

      Returns the host service.

  • LegacyThreadingSemantics

    Gets or sets a switch that enables or disables legacy threading semantics.

    public bool LegacyThreadingSemantics { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a switch that enables or disables legacy threading semantics; true if enabled, false otherwise.

    Remarks

    Legacy threading semantics indicate that if a submission is to be built only on the in-proc node and the submission is executed synchronously, then all of its requests will be built on the thread which invoked the build rather than a thread owned by the BuildManager.

  • Loggers

    Gets or sets the collection of loggers to use during the build.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger> Loggers { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<ILogger>

      Returns the collection of loggers to use during the build.

  • LogInitialPropertiesAndItems

    Gets or sets the flag determining whether the build logs the input parameters.

    public bool LogInitialPropertiesAndItems { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • LogTaskInputs

    Gets or sets the flag determining whether the build logs the task parameters.

    public bool LogTaskInputs { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • MaxNodeCount

    Gets or sets the maximum number of nodes this build may use.

    public int MaxNodeCount { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      Returns the maximum number of nodes this build may use.

  • MemoryUseLimit

    Gets or sets the amount of memory the build should limit itself to using, in megabytes.

    public int MemoryUseLimit { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      Returns the amount of memory the build should limit itself to using, in megabytes.

  • NodeExeLocation

    Gets or sets the location of the build node executable.

    public string NodeExeLocation { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the location of the build node executable.

  • OnlyLogCriticalEvents

    Gets or sets a flag that determines if non-critical logging events should be discarded.

    public bool OnlyLogCriticalEvents { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a flag that determines if non-critical logging events should be discarded.

  • ResetCaches

    Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether the build should reset the configuration and results caches.

    public bool ResetCaches { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a switch that specifies whether the build should reset the configuration and results caches; true if the caches should be reset, false otherwise.

  • SaveOperatingEnvironment

    Gets or sets a switch specifying if the operating environment, such as the current directory and environment, should be saved and restored between project builds and task invocations.

    public bool SaveOperatingEnvironment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a switch indicating whether the operating environment should be saved and restored between project builds and task invocations; true if the environment should be saved, false otherwise.

    Remarks

    This should be set to false for any other build managers running in the system so that we do not have two build managers trampling on each others environment.

  • ShutdownInProcNodeOnBuildFinish

    Gets or sets the flag determining whether to shut down the in process node when the build finishes. The default is false.

    public bool ShutdownInProcNodeOnBuildFinish { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • ToolsetDefinitionLocations

    Gets or sets locations to search for toolsets.

    public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ToolsetDefinitionLocations ToolsetDefinitionLocations { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ToolsetDefinitionLocations

      Returns locations to search for toolsets.

  • Toolsets

    Gets all of the toolsets.

    public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Toolset> Toolsets { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection<Toolset>

      Returns all of the toolsets.

  • UICulture

    Gets or sets the name of the UI culture to use during the build.

    public System.Globalization.CultureInfo UICulture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • CultureInfo

      Returns the name of the UI culture to use during the build.

  • UseSynchronousLogging

    Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether synchronous logging is used when there is only a single process.

    public bool UseSynchronousLogging { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a switch that specifies whether synchronous logging is used when there is only a single process; if true, use synchronous logging, otherwise use asynchronous logging.

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates a clone of this build parameters object.

    public Microsoft.Build.Execution.BuildParameters Clone ();

    Returns

    • BuildParameters

      Returns a clone of this build parameters object.

    Remarks

    This method creates a clone of the logger collections, but does not deeply clone the loggers within.

  • GetToolset(String)

    Gets a given toolset.

    public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Toolset GetToolset (string toolsVersion);

    Parameters

    • toolsVersion
      String

      The toolset to retrieve.

    Returns

    • Toolset

      Returns the toolset.
